Title: ECOWAS must match democratic promises with action
Summary: West African leaders under the umbrella of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) have pledged to deepen democracy and constitutional order . This commitment, coming from a region steeped in worsening political instability, must match democratic promises with action .

Title: FG charts path to $1 trillion GDP through strategic reforms, investment mobilisation
Summary: In 2026, the Federal Government of Nigeria (FGN) will focus on key policies and priorities to accelerate economic growth, create jobs and mobilize investments to build a prosperous Nigerian economy .

Title: FG reaffirms commitment to Nigeria-China strategic bilateral trade, economic partnership
Summary: FG reaffirms commitment to Nigeria-China strategic bilateral trade, economic partnership . Director-General and Global Liaison, Mr. Joseph Tegbe, has expressed confidence that Nigeria–China cooperation will continue .

Title: Soldiers disobey defence minister, mounts roadblock in South East –HURIWA
Summary: Human Rights Writers Association of Nigeria (HURIWA) alerted the newly sworn in Minister of Defence, General Christopher Gwabin Musa that soldiers did not respect his order withdrawing them from mounting roadblocks .

Title: Ugwuanyi: A diplomat by nature
Summary: Rt. Hon. Ifeanyi Ugwuanyi (CON) is the immediate past Governor of Enugu State . He is widely regarded as a diplomat by temperament and practice .

Title: Obi benefited from religious, tribal sentiments in 2023 — Kogi Rep
Summary: A member of the House of Representatives, Leke Abejide, said Peter Obi’s performance in the 2023 presidential election was influenced by religious and tribal sentiments . Title: Cervical cancer curable, says UN
Summary: UN says cervical cancer is both preventable and curable with proper access to screening, vaccination and treatment . Cervical cancer is a reproductive cancer that develops in a woman’s cervix and can spread to other parts of the body if not detected or treated early . Title: Canada deports 366 Nigerians, 974 await removal
Summary: Canada deported 366 Nigerians between January and October 2025 . Nigeria ranked ninth among the top 10 nationalities deported from Canada in the under review . 974 Nigerians are currently in the “removal in progress” inventory, awaiting deportation from Canada .

Title: Woman loses six children in Plateau fire
Summary: The people of Mangu town, Mangu Local Government Area of Plateau State, have been thrown into mourning following the deaths of six siblings in a late-night fire outbreak on Thursday .
